tweets.text: Breaking News . @EnvAgency have sanctioned the destruction of breeding birds tomorrow at the Lower Otter Restoration Project . This is #HS2 part 2 . PLEASE THINK AGAIN @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest Please follow @WiseBirding and RT https://t.co/I8Wv40YKqy

Gaywood river #Norfolk meanwhile just above the Bawsey ruins a field once regularly used to dispose of liquid waste but stopped in 2018 still appears to be killing the plants on the field & river bank 1st May 2021 & 2 from 2018 @EnvAgencyAnglia 3yrs & still no bund built 🤷‍♂️ https://t.co/hZZTNnmSuA https://t.co/VvkEbqZ5IJ

@ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding Destroying birds with HS2 and allowing lives to be destroyed with H2S. @EnvAgency you really are a despicable bunch aren't you!

Vegetation clearance starts from tomorrow. A very short visit this am incl: nest building Whitethroat, territorial Cetti's/Reed Warbler & Reed Bunting. Video shows how farcical this is! Still time to see sense @EnvAgency @kiergroup @Natures_Voice @Bucktonbirder  PLEASE RETWEET https://t.co/Tve0B6o4va

tweets.text: I wonder if we will get a comment before work starts from one of the lead project partners as shown on the LORP website?https://t.co/QmOqIv3ULS @ClintonDevon @EnvAgency @PebblebedHeaths https://t.co/NsYmoFJkdP

@GarethDennis @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding He is just stating that it appears to be a pattern were the legal requirement to protect species can be waived on a whim in hs2s case  it was through negligence.

Please listen now @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @NESouthWest @kiergroup This COULD be a fantastic project but you need to do the work at the correct time of year and NOT during the breeding season. Thanks @ChrisGPackham for the support and fingers crossed they see sense. https://t.co/En5Y1I6Rts

urls.title: Open WIMS data
urls.description: alpha This is a trial service – your feedback will help us to improve it. The data is updated within two working days of a new sample being added. We also do a complete data refresh each month which may include corrections to earlier data. The Water Quality Archive provides data on water quality measurements. Samples are taken at sampling points around England and can be from coastal or estuarine waters, rivers, lakes, ponds, canals or groundwaters. They are taken for a number of purposes including

tweets.text: Today on #50teams50days we celebrate the work of our Land & Water teams across the country. These are the folk out on the ground protecting our water environment - sometimes with some hi tech detective work! Check out all our water quality data here https://t.co/p9EMdpb9kE https://t.co/qQjNfKMr2r

tweets.text: It is. It is astonishing. But it is and @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice know it. So does @StaffordshireCC @PHE_uk @PHE_WestMids Thank You @DJAndyMoor for your support and voice @StinkStopthe https://t.co/cikerfAUTU
Crazy that this is / has been allowed to happen https://t.co/JSWqx5fXiA

So my #tuesdayvibe is yet again waking up after been poisoned in the night by landfill gas headache sore throat dry itchy eyes @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @PHE_uk this has to end would you live like this? #StopTheStink #CapItOff #AirPollution https://t.co/XYKP4YpoVI

No update from @EnvAgencyMids after capping deadline @RedIndustries2 Walleys Landfill?The stink has been horrendous over the weekend,EA  email complaint mailbox not functioning,the odour’s not been mitigated,it’s still out of control-failure on failure @StinkStopthe #stopthestink
